department.dept_long_name: Committee on Degrees in Social Studies

course.title: The Political Economy of Health in the Developing World
course.description: This course places the politics of health care in the context of economic development. Although health care and social programs are often considered secondary to economic growth, they have come to play an increasingly central role in development policy. This course explores the interaction between development and health through a survey of different theoretical approaches to development, combined with empirical research on public health, AIDS, family planning, and development programs.
